subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] On PALM
msgSnippet: I pronounce L (actually a pretty dark L) in Calm and Palm. I consider myself a pretty middle-of-the-road general American accent. I was raised as an Army
messageBody:
I pronounce 'L' (actually a pretty dark L) in Calm
and Palm.

I consider myself a pretty middle-of-the-road
general American accent. I was raised as an Army Brat,
so was exposed to *lots* of accents and dialects as I
grew up.

On another note, I believe these 'complexities'
were already there, they just loom larger in the
context of QS. I know I've become more phonemically
aware!

--- John Cowan <cowan@...> wrote:
> Ron Cameron scripsit:
> > Speak for yourself. In my dialect the "l" in
> palm, psalm, calm, balm, etc., is pronounced. :-)
>
> Hmm. What dialect do you speak?


===========
Never insult anyone by accident.
- Robert A. Heinlein

and Palm.

   I consider myself a pretty middle-of-the-road
general American accent. I was raised as an Army Brat,
so was exposed to *lots* of accents and dialects as I
grew up.

   On another note, I believe these 'complexities'
were already there, they just loom larger in the
context of QS. I know I've become more phonemically
aware!
